text: Write a quick email to Elena about the contract

Here's a draft for Elena Rodriguez:

To: elena.rodriguez@ventureworks.com
Subject: Contract Status Check-in

Hi Elena,

Quick check-in on the contract - any updates from legal?

Happy to jump on a call if there are questions.

Best,
John
I kept it short since you prefer concise emails. Should I save this as a draft?
Wait, I always write "Cheers" not "Best" when emailing Elena

Got it! I've updated the draft:

To: elena.rodriguez@ventureworks.com
Subject: Contract Status Check-in

Hi Elena,

Quick check-in on the contract - any updates from legal?

Happy to jump on a call if there are questions.

Cheers,
John

âœ¨ LEARNED: I'll use "Cheers" instead of "Best" for Elena Rodriguez from now on.

Should I save this as a draft?
Actually I use Cheers for everyone I know well

âœ¨ PREFERENCE UPDATED

I've learned that you prefer:
â€¢ "Cheers" - for contacts you know well
â€¢ "Best" - for formal/new contacts

I'll automatically apply this based on your relationship history with each contact. For example:

â€¢ Elena Rodriguez (2+ years, 100+ emails) â†’ "Cheers"
â€¢ Maria Santos (8 months, regular contact) â†’ "Cheers"
â€¢ New leads/prospects â†’ "Best"

This way your emails will feel natural without you having to think about it.

Draft updated - want me to save it?
yes. Also - I never schedule meetings before 10am

DRAFT SAVED âœ“

âœ¨ NEW PREFERENCE LEARNED

Calendar: No meetings before 10 AM

I'll apply this when:
â€¢ Suggesting meeting times
â€¢ Creating calendar events
â€¢ Responding to meeting requests

If someone proposes an early morning slot, I'll suggest alternatives starting at 10 AM.

Your preferences so far:

1. [HIGH CONFIDENCE] Keep emails concise and direct
   Learned from: 47 corrections over 3 months

2. [HIGH CONFIDENCE] Use "Cheers" for established contacts
   Learned from: Correction today, pattern confirmed

3. [MEDIUM CONFIDENCE] CC Sarah on deal-related emails
   Learned from: 12 instances where you added her

4. [MEDIUM CONFIDENCE] Include context from previous emails in replies
   Learned from: 8 corrections asking for more context
